lines.text: Dad, do you think words corrupt?
I don't know, let's try. Agnes?
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[looks up from the television]
Yes?
Nipple.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: Shh!
[turns back to the television]

[watches her a moment]
Well, there's no immediate physical change.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: Ah! My Second World War Nazi atrocity book came at last.
[turns to Youngman, dog in her lap, and browses the book]
Do you know what Bitsy and I do? We sit down and imagine all those atrocities being done to sex criminals. - Yes, sex criminals and the like. And that Dr Thorndike!

[overhearing]
What's that, Ginge? Bill Thorndike a sexy criminal?
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: The man you sent me to. He behaved VERY strangely.
What's your game, Mister?

[riffling a wad of bills under the warden's nose, to persuade him to eat a parking ticket]
Grand is the name, and, uh - money is the game. Would you care to play?
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[Oxford has just purposely rammed Cambridge, at the annual Boat Race]
It would never have happened in my day!
Nor mine!
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: Well, it's happenin' in mine!

[voiceover, as a £10 note appears onscreen]
Ladies and gentlemen, this is what is commonly known as money. It comes in all sizes, colours, and denominations - like people. We'll be using quite a bit of it in the next two hours... luckily I have enough for ALL of us.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[Laurence Harvey, onstage]
"To be..."

[loud enough to be heard, turning to Sir Guy]
I've seen it.
"Or not to be... that is the question."
Shakespeare, right?

[whispers, eyes toward the stage]
Right, and double right.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: You're certainly puttin' everybody on today, Dad.
Well, you know, Youngman, sometimes it's not enough merely to teach. One has to punish as well. A little bit of the old pause.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: Cause for pause?
Yes.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[as he and Youngman admire a painting]
I like school of Rembrandt.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: St. Rembrandt's High.

[pleads with Laurence, the ship's doctor]
If you could please just give me some tranquilizers...
Escape into drugs? Mask your fears in an artificial fog? Oh, surely you can't be serious.
Oh, well... give me some decent English aspirin!

[pulls out a lit marijuana joint]
Here, Sir Herb, try this. It's just what the doctor ordered.
What is it?
It's cannabis, Sir Herb.
[inhales, then, choked]
It'll tighten your wig.

[as all hell breaks loose, aboard the Magic Christian]
Youngman, what IS going on?

[innocently]
Ship's concert, I shouldn't wonder.

[on being told a Rembrandt might fetch £10,000 at auction]
In that case my final offer is thirty.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[stunned]
Thirty - thousand - pounds? Shit! I beg your pardon, I do beg your pardon.
Go to C-Deck immediately!

[a police car drives up to Grand's car]
Could be routine, or... mere damnable harassment.
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[Lawrence Harvey performs a strip tease while playing Hamlet]
This chap's taking licence in my view?
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text:
[speaking with the Oxford crew, before the annual Boat Race]
We have come here, in fact, to make you a very interesting offer...
lines.character: Sir Guy Grand KG, KC, CBE

lines.text: ...of money.

[as the whole crew laughs]
I think... I think they're trying to bribe us!

[giving a matter-of-fact look]
They ARE.
